clusters.title: US shoots down Iranian drone flying towards aircraft carrier, navy says
clusters.neutral_headline: US Military Shoots Down Iranian Drone

items.title: US shoots down Iranian drone flying towards aircraft carrier, navy says
items.standfirst: Shahed-139 said to have approached USS Abraham Lincoln ‘with unclear intent’ in lead-up to expected US-Iran talks on Tehran’s nuclear programmeThe US military says it shot down an Iranian drone that “aggressively” approached the Abraham Lincoln aircraft carrier in the Arabian Sea.The Iranian Shahed-139 drone was flying toward the carrier “with unclear intent” when an F-35 fighter jet shot it down, US Central Command said on Tuesday. Continue reading...
items.content: Shahed-139 said to have approached USS Abraham Lincoln ‘with unclear intent’ in lead-up to expected US-Iran talks on Tehran’s nuclear programmeThe US military says it shot down an Iranian drone that “aggressively” approached the Abraham Lincoln aircraft carrier in the Arabian Sea.The Iranian Shahed-139 drone was flying toward the carrier “with unclear intent” when an F-35 fighter jet shot it down, US Central Command said on Tuesday. Continue reading...

items.title: U.S. military shoots down Iranian drone that approached aircraft carrier
items.standfirst: American forces shot down an Iranian drone Tuesday as it “aggressively” approached the USS Abraham Lincoln aircraft carrier in the Arabian Sea and appeared to have “unclear intent,” U.S.
items.content: American forces shot down an Iranian drone Tuesday as it “aggressively” approached the USS Abraham Lincoln aircraft carrier in the Arabian Sea and appeared to have “unclear intent,” U.S.

items.title: US says shot down Iran drone that approached aircraft carrier in Arabian Sea
items.standfirst: A US stealth warplane shot down an Iranian drone that "aggressively" approached an American aircraft carrier as it sailed in the Arabian Sea on Tuesday, a US military spokesman said. The incident occurred with the carrier about 800 kilometers from Iran's coast, and came on the same day that American forces responded to Iranian boats that threatened to board a US-flagged tanker in the Strait of Hormuz. FRANCE 24's Reza Sayah reports from Tehran.
items.content: A US stealth warplane shot down an Iranian drone that "aggressively" approached an American aircraft carrier as it sailed in the Arabian Sea on Tuesday, a US military spokesman said. The incident occurred with the carrier about 800 kilometers from Iran's coast, and came on the same day that American forces responded to Iranian boats that threatened to board a US-flagged tanker in the Strait of Hormuz. FRANCE 24's Reza Sayah reports from Tehran.

items.title: US aircraft carrier scrambles fighter jet to down 'aggressive' Iranian drone
items.standfirst: A US fighter jet has shot down an Iranian drone that was flying "aggressively" towards an aircraft carrier, the US military has said.
items.content: A US fighter jet has shot down an Iranian drone that was flying "aggressively" towards an aircraft carrier, the US military has said.

items.title: US says it shot down Iranian drone flying towards aircraft carrier
items.standfirst: A US military spokesman says the drone was shot down while approaching an American vessel in the Arabian Sea.
items.content: A US military spokesman says the drone was shot down while approaching an American vessel in the Arabian Sea.

ai_summary: US navy shoots down Iranian drone approaching aircraft carrier
Drone was flying towards USS Abraham Lincoln in Arabian Sea
F-35 fighter jet used to shoot down the drone
Incident occurred before expected US-Iran talks on nuclear program

clusters.title: Trump Says He 'Got Along Well' With Colombian President Petro
clusters.neutral_headline: Trump Meets Colombian President Gustavo Petro

items.title: Trump Says He 'Got Along Well' With Colombian President Petro
items.standfirst: President Trump says he “got along very well” with Colombia’s President Gustavo Petro following their meeting at the White House. The meeting comes as both countries look to reset a once-close Washington–Bogotá relationship that has deteriorated over the past year. #trump #politics #worldnews…
items.content: President Trump says he “got along very well” with Colombia’s President Gustavo Petro following their meeting at the White House. The meeting comes as both countries look to reset a once-close Washington–Bogotá relationship that has deteriorated over the past year. #trump #politics #worldnews…

items.title: Colombian president and Trump put aside insults for amicable White House meeting
items.standfirst: Leaders had been trading hostile remarks for months but Gustavo Petro’s visit ended with warm words from US counterpartAfter months of trading insults – from “sick man” and “drug trafficking leader” on one side, to “accomplice to genocide” with a “senile brain” on the other – the first meeting between Donald Trump and Gustavo Petro ended with pleasantries, autographs and a Maga cap.The Colombian president was received by his US counterpart for a closed-door meeting at the White House, with no press access. Continue reading...
items.content: Leaders had been trading hostile remarks for months but Gustavo Petro’s visit ended with warm words from US counterpartAfter months of trading insults – from “sick man” and “drug trafficking leader” on one side, to “accomplice to genocide” with a “senile brain” on the other – the first meeting between Donald Trump and Gustavo Petro ended with pleasantries, autographs and a Maga cap.The Colombian president was received by his US counterpart for a closed-door meeting at the White House, with no press access. Continue reading...

items.title: Petro and Trump strike conciliatory tone after year of tensions
items.standfirst: Colombian President Gustavo Petro and US President Donald Trump appeared to reset strained relations during a White House meeting, signalling cooperation on drug trafficking and trade after months of sharp rhetoric and diplomatic friction.
items.content: Colombian President Gustavo Petro and US President Donald Trump appeared to reset strained relations during a White House meeting, signalling cooperation on drug trafficking and trade after months of sharp rhetoric and diplomatic friction.

items.title: Trump and Colombia's Gustavo Petro strike positive tone after a year of sniping at each other
items.standfirst: The two leaders have often clashed since Trump returned to office, including after the U.S. seized Venezuela's Nicolás Maduro. But their White House meeting appeared to go well.
items.content: The two leaders have often clashed since Trump returned to office, including after the U.S. seized Venezuela's Nicolás Maduro. But their White House meeting appeared to go well.

clusters.title: Trump signs funding bill to end shutdown after package clears House
clusters.neutral_headline: US Government Shutdown Ends With Funding Bill

items.title: Trump signs funding bill to end shutdown after package clears House
items.standfirst: The House on Tuesday voted 217 to 214 to fund major parts of the government and end the partial shutdown.
items.content: The House on Tuesday voted 217 to 214 to fund major parts of the government and end the partial shutdown.

items.title: Trump signs $1.2 trillion funding bill, ending government shutdown
items.standfirst: US President Donald Trump signed a sweeping $1.2 trillion government funding package to end a partial federal shutdown, while leaving unresolved a looming battle in Congress over short-term Homeland Security funding and immigration enforcement.
items.content: US President Donald Trump signed a sweeping $1.2 trillion government funding package to end a partial federal shutdown, while leaving unresolved a looming battle in Congress over short-term Homeland Security funding and immigration enforcement.

items.title: US House passes $1.2 trillion spending package to end government shutdown
items.standfirst: The spending package only funds the Department of Homeland Security for two weeks, through February 13.
items.content: The spending package only funds the Department of Homeland Security for two weeks, through February 13.

items.title: House votes to end partial government shutdown, setting up contentious talks on ICE
items.standfirst: The House has approved a spending bill to end a short-lived partial government shutdown. Now lawmakers will begin contentious negotiations over new guardrails for immigration enforcement.
items.content: The House has approved a spending bill to end a short-lived partial government shutdown. Now lawmakers will begin contentious negotiations over new guardrails for immigration enforcement.(Image credit: Aaron Schwartz)

ai_summary: Trump signs $1.2 trillion funding bill to end shutdown
Bill funds major parts of government until September
Package includes two-week funding for Homeland Security

items.title: Epstein files: UK's Mandelson to quit House of Lords
items.standfirst: Peter Mandelson is resigning from the House of Lords amid an investigation into his ties with Jeffrey Epstein. The British government is considering legislation to remove his noble title. Police are reviewing allegations that Mandelson shared sensitive information with Epstein, as revealed in recently released documents. Prime Minister Keir Starmer has ordered an urgent review of Mandelson's contacts with Epstein. FRANCE 24's Philip Turle has the details.
items.content: Peter Mandelson is resigning from the House of Lords amid an investigation into his ties with Jeffrey Epstein. The British government is considering legislation to remove his noble title. Police are reviewing allegations that Mandelson shared sensitive information with Epstein, as revealed in recently released documents. Prime Minister Keir Starmer has ordered an urgent review of Mandelson's contacts with Epstein. FRANCE 24's Philip Turle has the details.

items.title: India says trade deal with US 'best in the region' but keeps mum on Russian oil
items.standfirst: Following a social media announcement by Donald Trump about a trade deal, Indian officials hailed the agreement as 'the best in the region' while making no explicit comment about the US president's claim that Prime Minister Narendra Modi had agreed to stop buying Russian oil. Moscow meanwhile says it hasn't heard from India about any plans to do so. We take a closer look at how much crude oil India imports from Russia.

Moscow meanwhile says it hasn't heard from India about any plans to do so. We take a closer look at how much crude oil India imports from Russia.

Continue reading...

clusters.title: Police raid Paris offices of Musk's X over child sexual deepfakes
clusters.neutral_headline: French Police Raid Elon Musk's X Offices

items.title: Police raid Paris offices of Musk's X over child sexual deepfakes
items.standfirst: The Paris prosecutor's cybercrime unit raided the French offices of Elon Musk's social media platform X on Tuesday morning, as part of a probe into alleged offences including political interference, unlawful data extraction and sexualised deepfakes of women and children. Vedika Bahl goes through what we know so far, in Truth or Fake.
items.content: The Paris prosecutor's cybercrime unit raided the French offices of Elon Musk's social media platform X on Tuesday morning, as part of a probe into alleged offences including political interference, unlawful data extraction and sexualised deepfakes of women and children. Vedika Bahl goes through what we know so far, in Truth or Fake.

items.title: French headquarters of Elon Musk’s X raided by Paris cybercrime unit
items.standfirst: Prosecutors’ announcement comes amid a hardening of European attitudes to social media firmsProsecutors have raided the French headquarters of Elon Musk’s social media platform X and summoned the tech billionaire and the company’s former chief executive for questioning as part of an investigation into alleged cybercrime.“A search is under way by the cybercrime unit of the Paris prosecutor’s office, the national police cyber unit and Europol,” the Paris prosecutors’ office said in a post on X on Tuesday, adding that it would no longer be publishing on the network. Continue reading...
items.content: Prosecutors’ announcement comes amid a hardening of European attitudes to social media firmsProsecutors have raided the French headquarters of Elon Musk’s social media platform X and summoned the tech billionaire and the company’s former chief executive for questioning as part of an investigation into alleged cybercrime.“A search is under way by the cybercrime unit of the Paris prosecutor’s office, the national police cyber unit and Europol,” the Paris prosecutors’ office said in a post on X on Tuesday, adding that it would no longer be publishing on the network. Continue reading...

items.title: Trump adviser Stephen Miran quits White House role to stay on at Fed
items.standfirst: Miran, set to continue as Federal Reserve governor until Jerome Powell successor is confirmed, to leave CEA post Federal Reserve governor Stephen Miran has resigned from his position as chair of the White House’s council of economic advisers, fulfilling a pledge he made to the Senate as his assignment at the central bank becomes longer-lasting.Miran had been on unpaid leave from his CEA post since Donald Trump appointed him last year to fill an unexpected vacancy on the Fed’s board of governors to a term that expired on 31 January. The arrangement drew the ire of Democratic senators, who said it would make a presidential puppet of the Fed’s newest policymaker. Continue reading...
items.content: Miran, set to continue as Federal Reserve governor until Jerome Powell successor is confirmed, to leave CEA post Federal Reserve governor Stephen Miran has resigned from his position as chair of the White House’s council of economic advisers, fulfilling a pledge he made to the Senate as his assignment at the central bank becomes longer-lasting.Miran had been on unpaid leave from his CEA post since Donald Trump appointed him last year to fill an unexpected vacancy on the Fed’s board of governors to a term that expired on 31 January. The arrangement drew the ire of Democratic senators, who said it would make a presidential puppet of the Fed’s newest policymaker. Continue reading...

items.title: Mitch McConnell admitted to hospital with ‘flu-like symptoms’
items.standfirst: Statement says Republican senator, 83, checked himself into local hospital and prognosis is ‘positive’The Republican senator Mitch McConnell was admitted to a hospital on Monday night due to “flu-like symptoms”, his office said in a statement.“In an abundance of caution, after experiencing flu-like symptoms over the weekend, Senator McConnell checked himself into a local hospital for evaluation last night,” the statement reads. “His prognosis is positive and he is grateful for the excellent care he is receiving.” Continue reading...

At the time, the companies said they expected to finalize details “in the coming weeks.” Five months later, no deal has closed, Nvidia’s CEO now says the $100…
items.content: In September 2025, Nvidia and OpenAI announced a letter of intent for Nvidia to invest up to $100 billion in OpenAI’s AI infrastructure. At the time, the companies said they expected to finalize details “in the coming weeks.” Five months later, no deal has closed, Nvidia’s CEO now says the $100…

items.title: Nvidia's $100 billion OpenAI deal has seemingly vanished
items.standfirst: Two AI giants shake market confidence after investment fails to materialize.
items.content: In September 2025, Nvidia and OpenAI announced a letter of intent for Nvidia to invest up to $100 billion in OpenAI's AI infrastructure. At the time, the companies said they expected to finalize details "in the coming weeks." Five months later, no deal has closed, Nvidia's CEO now says the $100 billion figure was "never a commitment," and Reuters reports that OpenAI has been quietly seeking alternatives to Nvidia chips since last year. Reuters also wrote that OpenAI is unsatisfied with the speed of some Nvidia chips for inference tasks, citing eight sources familiar with the matter. Inference is the process by which a trained AI model generates responses to user queries. According to the report, the issue became apparent in OpenAI's Codex, an AI code-generation tool. OpenAI staff reportedly attributed some of Codex's performance limitations to Nvidia's GPU-based hardware. After the Reuters story published and Nvidia's stock price took a dive, Nvidia and OpenAI have tried to smooth things over publicly. OpenAI CEO Sam Altman posted on X: "We love working with NVIDIA and they make the best AI chips in the world. We hope to be a gigantic customer for a very long time. I don't get where all this insanity is coming from."Read full article Comments

ai_summary: Nvidia's $100 billion OpenAI deal has not materialized
The companies announced a letter of intent in September 2025
No deal has been closed after five months
Nvidia's CEO says the $100 billion deal is no longer happening
The deal's disappearance has shaken market confidence

It involved a record number of 71 ballistic missiles as well as 450 drones, he said, sent to destroy energy infrastructure. Continue reading...
